nodes.bodyText:
This here should be a FabricMaterialBuilder (this is the v0 package) but is being handled by #533.
This change is already done in the v1 package
Please refer to the actual replacement class in these using @link
adding this is superfluous IMO, it is ok (=optional) for new code, but changing existing code is not necessary.
i509VCB when he uses the Sponge formatter 😛
I think this change was a style preference for me where I use this religiously when accessing fields which are a part of the class.
the module name should use singular "builder"
The package doesn't correspond to the requirements outlined at https://github.com/FabricMC/fabric/blob/1.15/checkstyle.xml#L158 - please adjust

nodes.bodyText: Something should probably be done about these constructors and factory methods, some use static of(), some static create(), some public constructors like this one. Full consistency is IMO not /that/ important, but it should at least be considered and discussed.

Hmm I would be fine with using of or create.
Since this a builder we may want to consider that of or create doesn't make 100% sense
how about... builder?
FabricMaterial.builder() or something

I'd personally lean towards builder().
@sfPlayer1 what do you think of that?
I don't like it, you use this in the non-builder class, which we don't have.
well normally with a builder you either have a builder method in the built class or you use the builder's constructor. IMO the constructor is fine and should be the standard, at least for builders.
Chose to stick with the ctors since this is relatively simple

Chose to stick with the ctors since this is relatively simple

No, there should be consistency for consturcting material builder and block settings. Either make material builder use utility methods or make block settings use constructors.
Is it possible to have a simple util method to copy from an existing material
Also really would like to have methods to unset settings, such as unset requires tools
Why not mixing the field into the block settings class?

Makes sense to reduce Map calls, but that will be to @sfPlayer1 to decide since I dont want to reinvent the entire wheel.
It's already an improvement this isn't a inner class of an api class anymore
Block.Settings isn't a builder, this is.
Not sure why this replied to the wrong comment. The mobile app sucks. It should be a reply to liach's comment on the material builder.
The field should be a lot safer, this asks for the contents to become stale/never read again
So to you want me to store the extra data via a mixin in the Block.Settings? In a field
